medical_history.chief_complaint: Unintentional needlestick injury while caring for Ebola patients.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The needlestick occurred on September 26, 2014. The patient was evacuated and offered postexposure vaccination, which he consented to; he was vaccinated on September 28, 2014. Symptoms including fever and moderate to severe symptoms developed 12 hours after vaccination and diminished over 3 to 4 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Strabismus with monocular vision, tonsillectomy as a child, intermittent cigarette smoking.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of Factor V Leiden, but the patient had no thromboembolism history.
medical_history.social_history: Currently taking doxycycline for malaria prophylaxis and using nicotine chewing gum.
